text: Explores Black and Caribbean counternarratives to the whitewashed archives of the long nineteenth century, with a specific focus on Saidiya Hartman and Nalo Hopkinson.
Oil painting depicting rough ocean in which a ship sails and bodies float in the water.
Diana Rose Newby, Jessie Reeder, Oishani Sengupta, and Emma Soberano
Undisciplining In and Through Contemporary Texts

Cherrie Kwok, PhD specializes in Global Anglophone Literatures from the nineteenth century to today, with a focus on race, imperialism, and an artistic style and political concept called decadence. Pronouns: she/her.
Turner, J. M. W. The Slave Ship. Oil on canvas, 1840. Museum of Fine Arts Boston. Public domain in the USA because it is a faithful photographic reproduction of a work that was published before 1928.
